definition: to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: Liars of terrible devotion, caverns of virgins, ferocious places.
sentences.chinese: 残忍的苦行窟，处女们的火坑，蛮不讲理的地方。

sentences.english: They angrily insisted that the manager return their nonrefundable deposit.
sentences.chinese: 他们蛮不讲理，一定要经理退还原本不该退还的押金。

sentences.english: It rubs to work under such an obstinate man.
sentences.chinese: 在这种蛮不讲理的人手下工作真令人恼火。

definition: to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
not understanding things (idiom); devoid of sense
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
